cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi ENE of Daytona Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving NNW today, then turning north tonight and NNE Thursday, skirting the Georgia coast and tracking very near or over the South Carolina and North Carolina coasts before accelerating northeastward offshore
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South‒North Carolina border (around Cape Fear/Cape Lookout coastal stretch)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch north of Surf City NC to Poquoson VA (including Hampton Roads, Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds, Neuse & Pamlico Rivers); Hurricane Watch north of Surf City NC to the NC/VA border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from north of Savannah River GA to Surf City NC; Storm Surge Warning Sebastian Inlet FL to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through North Carolina, with greatest impacts expected along the South Carolina and southern/central North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are very likely and hurricane-force gusts are possible late Thursday night through Friday as Dorian’s core passes just offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 4–7 ft above ground level possible along the Cape Fear coast, including the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent sounds.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated amounts up to 15 inches, producing a high risk of flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; a few tornadoes possible in outer rainbands Thursday–Friday.
